item.title: Platinum Guild rides double-digit surge as Young India seeks more than ‘Just Gold’ | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Platinum Guild rides double-digit surge as Young India seeks more than ‘Just Gold’

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Mint

India’s fascination with gold is legendary, but platinum is quickly carving out its own space, especially among young consumers who want jewellery to mean more than a mere “store of value.”

  • High levels of awareness and consideration for platinum among consumers.
  • Sustained double-digit growth in platinum sales.
  • Expansion of platinum marketing efforts into tier-2 and tier-3 towns.
  • Consumer marketing director Sujala Martis discusses evolving consumer mindsets.
  • Focus on the emotive aspects of platinum compared to gold.
“Platinum is seen as a more meaningful choice among the younger generation, reflecting personal expression rather than just investment.”

The growing trend of young consumers seeking more from their jewellery indicates a significant shift in marketing for the platinum industry aimed at emotional connections.

item.title: UK study warns of perils in AI-driven 'intention economy' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
UK Study Warns of Perils in AI-Driven 'Intention Economy'

Date: Dec 30, 2024

Source: Harvard Data Science Review

Researchers from the University of Cambridge have issued a warning about the dangers of a new marketplace they term the 'intention economy,' wherein conversational AI could influence user decision-making.

  • The 'intention economy' could affect decisions ranging from buying movie tickets to voting.
  • Chatbots and AI agents could enable persuasive technologies that manipulate user behavior.
  • Unchecked AI could lead to 'social manipulation on an industrial scale.'
  • AI tools will be developed to collect and commodify human intentions.
  • Co-author Jonnie Penn emphasizes the need for regulation to prevent intentions from being treated as a currency.
“We should start to consider the likely impact such a marketplace would have on human aspirations...” - Jonnie Penn

The study highlights the importance of public awareness to mitigate the risks associated with the intention economy.

item.title: Why I Finally Switched to an iPad After Using an Android Tablet for Years - MUO - MakeUseOf
item.description:
Why I Finally Switched to an iPad After Using an Android Tablet for Years

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: MakeUseOf

The author discusses their transition from an Android tablet to an iPad, highlighting the benefits of seamless integration with other Apple devices, screen size, and suitable apps for light work.

  • Seamless integration with MacBook and iPhone simplifies multitasking.
  • The large screen of the iPad Air provides valuable desktop real estate.
  • The iPad Air offers necessary apps and accessories for efficient light work.
  • Great for light work and professional photography tasks.
  • Has all the essential apps needed for productivity.
  • Accessories improve functionality, such as external drives and keyboards.
“While Samsung’s giant Galaxy Tab S10 Ultra is a tempting offer, I ultimately found better value in the 13-inch M2 iPad Air.”

This article emphasizes the advantages the author found in switching to the iPad, suggesting it as a strong contender for those considering a change from Android tablets.

item.title: YouTube is testing a floating ‘Play something’ button - The Verge
item.description:
YouTube Tests New Floating 'Play Something' Button

Publication Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: 9to5Google

YouTube is introducing a new floating 'Play Something' button in its Android app that selects a video for users to watch.

  • YouTube is currently testing a floating button that appears just above the bottom bar in the app.
  • The button auto-selects a video to play when tapped.
  • The feature utilizes the portrait-oriented YouTube Shorts player.
  • This initiative follows a similar feature by Netflix, which retired its own random video picker last year.
“Play Something” is reminiscent of a feature that Netflix offered, called “Surprise Me,” which launched in 2021.

This latest feature reflects YouTube's attempt to enhance user engagement by offering randomized content suggestions.

item.title: Tessan Teams Up with World-Renowned Singer to Inspire a New Era of Connected Journeys - openPR
item.description:
Tessan Teams Up with World-Renowned Singer to Inspire a New Era of Connected Journeys

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: openPR

Tessan announces a partnership with a globally renowned singer-songwriter to enhance travel experiences through innovative charging solutions. This collaboration aims to redefine travel convenience and expand Tessan's reach in new markets.

  • Tessan has received multiple design awards in 2024, including the Muse Design Award and Red Dot Design Award.
  • The partnership is inspired by the spirit of discovery and aims to connect travelers worldwide.
  • Tessan's key products, including WTA Series Travel Adapters and Multifunctional Power Strips, are designed for convenience and usability.
  • The collaboration aligns with sustainable practices, utilizing eco-friendly materials and energy-efficient designs.
  • Tessan's mission involves empowering users to charge devices responsibly while traveling.
"With the collaboration, we aim to inspire travelers to embrace their journeys and showcase how our products can enhance their travel experience." - Tessan's spokesperson

This collaboration represents a significant step for Tessan in solidifying its leadership in travel tech accessories, promising to connect more travelers with the world effectively.

item.description:
Oppo Find N5 Specifications Have Reportedly Been Leaked: From Design & Camera To Battery

Publication Date: 2024-12-01 Source: Tech News

As Oppo gears up for 2025, key specifications of the Find N5 have reportedly been leaked, hinting at significant improvements over its predecessor.

  • 6.4-inch external display with 120Hz refresh rate and 8-inch main screen with 2K resolution.
  • Powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Elite processor and a 5700mAh battery with 80W wired charging.
  • Rumored 50W wireless charging support.
  • Triple-camera system with three 50MP sensors for versatile photography.
  • Expected configurations up to 16GB RAM and 1TB storage.
“These leaked specifications should be taken cautiously, as Oppo has yet to officially confirm any details.”

Speculation suggests an official announcement will occur shortly after the Chinese New Year in 2025, possibly in February.

item.title: Samsung patents this week covered an XR Headset with adjustable lenses, SIM & more + smartphones with expandable displays - Patently Apple
item.description:
Samsung's Latest Patents on XR Headset and Smartphones with Expandable Displays

Date: November 25, 2024

Source: Patently Apple

Samsung has recently filed multiple patents focusing on innovative technology for an XR headset and smartphones with expandable displays. Notably, the XR headset features adjustable lenses and advanced wireless capabilities, potentially integrating SIM functionality.

  • Samsung's XR headset patents include technology for adjustable lens distance and wireless communication, emphasizing cellular and short-range wireless standards.
  • A key feature of the headset is the inclusion of new radio access technology that supports enhanced mobile broadband and low-latency communications.
  • Reports indicate potential applications for a smartphone with an expandable display, aimed at balancing portability with screen size.
  • The expandable display concept might be showcased at CES 2025, alongside innovations from other companies.
“The need for a display size that can be changed is increasing so that a user may receive various contents through the electronic device.”

In summary, Samsung's latest patents indicate a strategic move towards more versatile and advanced consumer electronics, with the potential to significantly impact the market.

item.title: These are our favorite reader-created Android wallpapers of 2024 - Android Authority
item.description:
Favorite Reader-Created Android Wallpapers of 2024

Published on: August 28, 2024 by Android Authority

Every Wednesday, Android Authority showcases a series called Wallpaper Wednesday, featuring wallpapers created by readers and staff. This year, 18 standout images were selected as favorites.

  • Readers submitted six wallpapers, complemented by three from staff.
  • Images include stunning photographs and creative digital art.
  • High-resolution versions of wallpapers can be downloaded from a provided link.

Best Android Wallpapers from Our Readers in 2024

  1. Indian mountain range — Pranav Wagh (Galaxy S24 Ultra)
  2. Cayenne peppers — Martin Kaloki (OnePlus Nord 2T)
  3. Spiral stairs — Raj Venkatesh (Unknown device)
  4. Gas mask — S. S. Alam Sohan (Unknown device)

  6. Bug husk — Han Le (Google Pixel 6 Pro)
  7. Processed tree stump — Rick L. Thompson (Google Pixel 4a)

  11. Water droplets — Kaustav Pramanik (Unknown device)

  13. Glitched-out — Jeremy Wood (Unknown device)
  14. Starry night — Cossam (Unknown device)
  15. Bird — Bongo Spear (Unknown device)
  16. Dubai dunes — Shantanu Chodankar (OnePlus 7T)
  17. Mosaic tiles — Kelly Green (OnePlus 11)
  18. Sleepy pupper — Shubhajyoti Biswas (Motorola Edge 30)

Thanks to all who submitted their photos! Wallpaper downloads are available via a Google Drive link.

item.title: Vivo X200 Pro Review: The Flagship Phone To Beat In 2025 - Forbes
item.description:
Vivo X200 Pro Review: The Flagship Phone To Beat In 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Forbes

The Vivo X200 Pro has successfully addressed past concerns and is now regarded as one of the most complete flagship smartphones. It excels particularly in its camera capabilities, making it a strong contender as we head into 2025.

The Best Camera Setup On A Smartphone

  • 50MP + 200MP + 50MP camera configuration for stunning photography.
  • Excellent performance in daylight with great dynamic range and accurate colors.
  • Improved portrait mode for edge detection and background separation.
  • New macro capabilities and impressive night mode performance.

Fixing Issues Of The Past

  • Better in-hand feel with improved dimensions compared to previous models.
  • Enhanced 6.78-inch UHD AMOLED display with high brightness and reduced flicker.
  • Long-lasting 6,000mAh battery with quick charging capabilities.

Powerful Performance and Improved UI

  • MediaTek Dimensity 9400 SoC offers excellent performance.
  • AI features to enhance user experience.
  • Promises four years of OS upgrades and five years of security updates.

Vivo X200 Pro Review: Verdict

Priced at INR 94,999, the Vivo X200 Pro offers a compelling package with superior camera technology and long-lasting performance, establishing it as one of the best flagship smartphones available.

Pros:

  • Good in-hand feel
  • Top-notch camera quality
  • Most versatile camera system on the market
  • Bright and vibrant display
  • Reliable battery life

Cons:

  • Selfie camera could be better

item.title: Fintech’s new fuel: Venture debt takes centrestage amid a funding crunch | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Fintech’s New Fuel: Venture Debt Takes Centre Stage Amid a Funding Crunch

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Company Business News

As venture capital investments into India’s financial technology sector plunged this year, fintech companies are increasingly turning to venture debt as an alternative funding source.

  • Venture debt allows early-stage companies to raise capital without diluting equity.
  • Venture debt is becoming more prevalent as venture capital becomes scarce due to regulatory oversight.
  • Despite the rise of venture debt, venture capital remains the primary financing method for startups.
"Venture debt is essentially a high-interest loan advanced to early stage companies that want to raise capital without diluting equity."

The growing use of venture debt highlights a shift in the fintech funding landscape caused by changing regulatory dynamics.

item.title: How to download all photos and videos from Google Photos at once - The Indian Express
item.description:
How to Download All Photos and Videos from Google Photos at Once

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Indian Express

Google Photos is a popular platform for backing up photos and videos, but downloading everything at once can be challenging. This guide provides a straightforward method for backing up your data.

  • Visit takeout.google.com and log in with your Google account.
  • Select Google Photos from the available options.
  • Choose to receive the download link via email.
  • Opt for 'zip' as the file type for compatibility.
  • Select file size based on your data bandwidth preference (options include 1 GB, 2 GB, 10 GB, and 50 GB).
  • Click on 'Create export' to process your request.
  • Expect a download link via email which remains valid for one week.
"Once you receive the link, click on it to download all the photos and videos from Google Photos."

After following these steps, you'll have a local copy of your Google Photos content without hassle.

item.title: Can’t decide what to watch? YouTube’s new feature could be just the fix | Mint - Mint
item.description:
YouTube Introduces New Feature to Help Users Decide What to Watch

Publication Date: Not specified Source: 9to5Google

YouTube has launched a new feature aimed at improving user experience by reducing the endless scrolling for video content. The feature includes a 'Play Something' button that starts playing suggested videos based on user preferences.

  • YouTube is testing a floating action button labeled 'Play Something'.
  • The feature is designed to play videos in both the Shorts player and the regular video interface.
  • Users can interact with large buttons for likes, dislikes, comments, and sharing.
  • The button has been in testing since at least May 2023.
  • No official rollout date for all users has been announced.
“The feature reportedly considers content preferences before suggesting a new video.”

This new feature from YouTube is part of its ongoing efforts to enhance user engagement and streamline content discovery.

item.title: Apple discontinues iPhone 14 and iPhone SE as USB-C becomes mandatory in Europe - The Indian Express
item.description:
Apple Discontinues iPhone 14 and SE as USB-C Becomes EU Standard

Date: December 28, 2024

Source: The Indian Express

On December 28, USB-C became the mandatory standard for electronic devices in the EU, leading Apple to discontinue the iPhone 14 and iPhone SE, the last models with the Lightning port.

  • EU law mandates a single charger for various electronic devices to reduce e-waste.
  • The new standard doesn't impact users with existing Lightning or micro-USB devices directly.
  • Apple will continue to sell older models outside the EU while plans for a new USB-C iPhone SE are underway.
“Today’s the day! USB-C is officially the common standard for electronic devices in the EU! It means: One charger to rule them all.” — European Commission in Cyprus

This regulatory change showcases significant shifts in the tech industry as manufacturers adapt to new standards, aiming to benefit consumers through convenience and reduced environmental impact.
